snippet: A radio station has angered the Taliban by broadcasting pro-government ads, but that did not stop American Special Forces from raiding it.
abstract: Qazi Nasir Mudassir, owner of radio station that broadcasts in Afghanistan's Logar Province, area troubled by insurgent activity, says he was beaten by American soldiers after they arrested him and two other employees; says soldiers were apparently unaware that station is largely supported by pro-government, pro-coalition advertisements paid for by American military.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and JAWAD SUKHANYAR

lead_paragraph: A radio station has angered the Taliban by broadcasting pro-government ads, but that did not stop American Special Forces from raiding it.

headline.main: Afghan Broadcaster Says U.S. Soldiers Abused Him
